wikipedia_page.main: Charles John Vaughan (23 April 1921 – 16 March 1989) was an English footballer who played for Charlton Athletic and Portsmouth as a centre forward during the 1940s and 1950s.Vaughan started his career with Sutton United. He helped them win numerous wartime honours, scored 42 league goals in the 1945–46 season to win the Athenian League, and finished his Sutton United career with 248 goals in all competitions. He was inducted into the club's Hall of Fame.In 1950, Vaughan toured Canada with a Football Association party, and in March 1952, he appeared in an England B international against the Netherlands.
